intro: Chamaeraphis penicillata, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found in tidal zones and along shorelines. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves with a central flowering stem. Chamaeraphis penicillata plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
